channel.title: Attention: Java Virus?
channel.description:
Well, Today and for the last week I've been gettings java errors on startup.. And I don't have Java.exe on the services list to run on startup. So I check it out, then i get messageboxes that say:
I Now Own your Life
All seperately.. Then i end java.exe and the Fail Virus is over.. BTW it Messed with my Registry.. It won't let you install antiviruses.

item.title: Attention: Java Virus?
item.dc:creator: @CAPT_AMERIKA AMERIKA
item.description:
@CAPT_AMERIKA wrote:

[quote=“Explisionist, post:9, topic:288477”][quote author=_ikram link=topic=381391.msg2866072#msg2866072 date=1247472804]
Java can never contain viruses, but they can contain certain bad code’s.
[/quote]

I feel like laughing at you for that post.

Java can contain viruses, its called making a virus in a .exe file, its not hard… and its simple to do if u program it in Java.[/quote]

who ever wrote that is a fucking retard. If the file is .exe, then it isn’t java. Java is shit like .jar and .class. I don’t know if you can even convert a file from .jar to .exe

Read full topic

lolwut

Its not really a virus, more of a prank.

Read full topic

item.title: Attention: Java Virus?
item.dc:creator: @mod_taharok Taharok
item.description:
@mod_taharok wrote:

A virus is simply a bad name for a program containing malicious code. I don’t care what programming language you use, it can have malicious code. If you don’t know exactly what it is, don’t run it. If you follow that idea, the odds are low that you’ll ever be “infected” with anything.

Read full topic
